content.description:
A 2 pitch adventure up the Stellar Walls.  Pitch 2 is one of the more serious pitches in the area in terms of difficulty and bolt spacing.

P1 5.9 (Little Chicken, 80'):  Start from the ledge as for Stellar Crack and traverse left and up, following the bolts.  First move is protected by a medium nut.  Follows a series of overlaps and right facing dihedrals.  Anchor is way out to the right making the exit exciting for the second.

P2 5.10d (Unfinished Business, 120'):  Head up broken rock to a ledge from where it is hard to continue due to undercut feet and small hands.  Up and a step left from here.  The route gets progressively easier until a headwall is reached.  The headwall is entertaining with a slight overhang but good holds.
content.protection:
Medium nut for start, to protect leftward traverse.  Easy but dangerous without the nut.

It may be wise to place a cam before the headwall is reached as it is run out but easy to the headwall bolt.  I just ran it out so I can't say what size would fit but medium is a good guess from looking around.  It is good to place a longer quickdraw on the first headwall bolt to avoid drag.
content.location: Left side of Stellar Crack ledge.  Can rap from P1 but must walk off climbers' left from P2 due to length of pitch.  There is also a rap station ~80' to climbers' right at top but is hard to find.

content.description: The best 5.7 crack in San Diego!  Climb up a left facing dihedral with a frictiony face for feet and a Stellar Crack for hands and gear.  Exit up and right to a ledge on some exciting face climbing.
content.protection: Small to 2".  Save some small finger sized gear for higher up.

content.description: Overhanging granite with some good handholds leads to a wild crux bulge.
content.protection: The overhanging part is all bolted (6).  The upper section takes some gear.  Yellow Alien (.3") to 1".
content.location: Far right into the Dragon's Den area.

content.description: A prominent arete that offers both slippery and sticky rock.  One section is steep while the rest is more balancy.  It can be tricky to find the path of least resistance.
content.protection: 8 bolts, optional yellow alien.  Well protected.  The end may feel a bit run-out without the cam but it is not too difficult.
content.location: The prominent arete just right of Stellar Crack.
